intro: Solenarium fistulosum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens in suitable climates.
